intro: Calandrinia calyptrata, commonly known as the Christmas flower or flame flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in winter, making it a striking addition to gardens during the colder months. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Calandrinia calyptrata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
